Body:
Description: Hi,
I'd several tries to get the backend updates installed but nothin happens.

TO DO:

 

Customer is from Berlin, but speaks English.

Requires RS.

Customer sent time intervals for next week(3rd of March week):

  1. The EPP server ise hosted on our site
  2. It is hosted as a VM in vmSphere
  3. Monday between 9:00 and 12:00 and 14:00-17:00, Tuesday 14:00-17:00, Wednesday between 14:00-15:00

 

Steps to do:

Check backed to see if boot partition is over 40%, if yes use the below procedure to clear it and after that re-apply the security updates:

 

0. Check free space of /boot partition

 

df -h

 

1. Run:

 

dpkg --configure -a

 

This will fix dpkg being broken from last failed upgrade process.

 

2. Check and note down version of currently running kernel:

 

uname -r

 

3. Remove all but currently running kernel packages:

 

apt-get remove --purge `dpkg -l | grep linux | egrep -e 'linux-generic|linux-headers|linux-hwe|linux-image|linux-modules' | grep -v $(uname -r) | awk '{print $2}'`

 

Note: if this removes any -headers package or other pertaining to current kernel don't worry, we'll remove anything related to the current running kernel later anyway.

 

4. Install linux-generic-hwe-22.04 kernel and reboot:

 

apt-get update

 

apt-get --no-install-recommends install linux-generic-hwe-22.04

 

reboot

 

5. Remove all packages related to old kernel version, replacing '5.19.0.41-generic' text with version noted down at step 2.

 

apt-get remove --purge `dpkg -l | grep linux | awk '{print $2}' | grep 5.19.0.41-generic`

 

6. Reboot and check that the EPP server is up and running:

 

reboot

 

7. Done !
Invitation updated. Attendees: No attendees listed
Invitation updated. Attendees: Alin Anca, Detlef Janik
What We've Learned Updated: the customer had 233 MB free on the boot partition so we proceeded with the manual installation
Next Steps Updated: - connect with customer over the remote session and investigate in the backend
